title: West Virginia - poverty rate from 2000 to 2018
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Percentage of population, with a total of 19 data points. The chart has 7 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2011 to 2007.
Additionally, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2016 to 2013.
But, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2003 to 2000.
But, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2018 to 2016.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2013 to 2011.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2007 to 2005.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2005 to 2003.
gold: This graph shows the poverty rate in West Virginia from 2000 to 2018 . In 2018 , 17.8 percent of West Virginia 's population lived below the poverty line .
